summary: This is a sealed application and order from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a phone line subscribed to 'G Max' for 60 days. The surveillance is part of a criminal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and others for potential violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the primary target of an FBI investigation for possible violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 371, 2423(a), and 2422. The pen register is being sought on a phone line associated with 'G Max'.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney filing the application states they are from his office. He is the supervising federal prosecutor for the district.

events.title: Court Order Authorizing Pen Register
events.description: A federal judge signs an order authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a phone line subscribed to 'G Max' for 60 days.

events.title: Government Application for Surveillance
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney files a sealed application requesting court authorization for a pen register on a phone associated with 'G Max' as part of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell in June 2020 for potential violations of sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. § 1591), conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371), and related statutes.
The investigation sought to surveil a phone line subscribed under the name 'G Max', strongly suggesting it was used by Ghislaine Maxwell.
The surveillance authorized was a pen register/trap-and-trace device, which captures metadata (phone numbers, IP addresses, dates, times, durations) but not the content of communications.
The order was sealed to prevent disclosure of the investigation to the target subjects, indicating the covert nature of this phase of the probe.
